attacks.name: Dark Song
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Slap Awake
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep or Confused, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. Then, the Defending Pokémon is no longer Asleep or Confused.

attacks.name: Warm Up
attacks.text: If you have any benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Energy card and attach it to 1 of them. Then shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Flame
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard a Energy card attached to Light Flareon or this attack does nothing. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Pulse Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or more damage is done to Light Jolteon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Thunder Needle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Return Home
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, shuffle 1 of them and all cards attached to it into your deck.

attacks.name: Gentle Kick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage. If it has any, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Wash Away
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon and discard all Energy cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Hypno Shower
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 1 damage counter from each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) with any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Impostor Professor Oak's Invention
text: Look at your opponent's Prize cards. You may have your opponent shuffle them into his or her deck. If you do, your opponent takes that many cards from the top of his or her deck and sets them aside as his or her new Prize cards (without looking at them).

cards.name: Radio Tower
text: Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may look at the top 2 cards of his or her deck and put them back in the same order.

cards.name: Thought Wave Machine (Rocket's Secret Machine)
text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, return an Energy card attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon to your opponent's hand. If the Pokémon has fewer attached Energy cards than that, return all of them to your opponent's hand. Your turn is over now (you don't get to attack).

cards.name: Magnifier
text: Attach Magnifier to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard Magnifier. If the Pokémon Magnifier is attached to attacks, don't apply Resistance for that attack.

cards.name: Heal Powder
text: Flip a coin. If heads, your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned and remove 2 damage counters from it. If your Active Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Mail from Bill
text: You can't play this card if you have 5 or more cards in your hand (including this one). Draw cards until you have exactly 4 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Healing Water
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon equal to the number of Energy cards attached to Shining Celebi. If the Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Miracle Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. If you get 1 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, or Poisoned (your choice).
